intro: Vittadinia cuneata var. morrisii, commonly known as the slender vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
